critique: This document establishes a board to investigate a labor dispute between United Air Lines and its employees. It aims to prevent interruption of interstate commerce. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It seems to be a fairly standard intervention in a labor dispute to maintain essential services. The order doesn't obviously expand executive power, but uses existing authority under the Railway Labor Act. It doesn't directly address federalism or social inclusion. It does involve government in economic matters by intervening in a labor dispute.
